intro: Spermacoce articularis, commonly known as the jointweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its leaves are opposite, simple, and often elliptical in shape. Spermacoce articularis produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which split into two one-seeded parts upon maturity. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
